channel.title: Incorporate webpage into Jframe?
channel.description:
Is there any way that you can have a website incorporated into your jframe? I know you can do this with VB, but not sure about java...
Thanks

item.title: Incorporate webpage into Jframe?
item.dc:creator: @1337h4x 1337h4x
item.description:
@1337h4x wrote:

[quote=“lawl, post:2, topic:105398”]you can use a jeditorpane, its good but it doesnt support a lot of standard features
or use jdic package and a browser plugin thingeh[/quote]the jdick package?

Read full topic

item.title: Incorporate webpage into Jframe?
item.dc:creator: @Pwnd Pwnd
item.description:
@Pwnd wrote:

[quote=“Javacisnotrecognized, post:4, topic:105287”]What the fuck do you mean “website incorporated into jframe” ? Do you even know what a website it? It’s a bunch of pictures and buttons and text and text areas and content available with 3rd party plugins and etc[/quote]He said webpage, pleb. I’m thinking he wants to have Java interpret a webpage and display it.

Read full topic

item.title: Incorporate webpage into Jframe?

[quote=“lawl, post:1, topic:105398”][quote author=I Am Olan14 link=topic=150856.msg1426134#msg1426134 date=1180903496]
Yes, its easy.
I have like 5 WebBrowser Java projects Im working on.
Im trying to let them read CSS and JavaScript not just text and and HTML.
So yes, it is.
I have 5 working Java WebBrowsers.
[/quote]
err? 5 java browsers? wtf does that mean? either way, you really sound retarded in that post[/quote]Why would you have 5
